summary: The Age 21 Act (S. 597) amends U.S. Code Title 18 to prohibit the purchase of certain firearms and large-capacity ammunition feeding devices by individuals under 21 years of age. It defines "semiautomatic pistol," "semiautomatic shotgun," and "semiautomatic assault weapon," along with associated components. It also defines "large capacity ammunition feeding device", "barrel shroud", "detachable ammunition feeding device", "fixed ammunition feeding device", "folding, telescoping, or detachable stock", "forward grip", "grenade launcher", "pistol grip", "threaded barrel", and "belt-fed semiautomatic firearm". The bill also includes exemptions for military personnel and specific situations and modifies penalties. It also provides a list of specific firearms covered by the bill.
